sub_topic: Finding the cross product of two vectors using trigonometry
message_1: A math student is given two vectors, vector A = [3, 4, 1] and vector B = [2, -1, 5]. Using trigonometry, determine the cross product of these two vectors.
message_2:
To find the cross product of two vectors A and B, we can use the formula:

A x B = [AyBz - AzBy, AzBx - AxBz, AxBy - AyBx]

where A = [Ax, Ay, Az] and B = [Bx, By, Bz].

Given A = [3, 4, 1] and B = [2, -1, 5], we can plug in the values into the formula:

A x B = [(4)(5) - (1)(-1), (1)(2) - (3)(5), (3)(-1) - (4)(2)]

A x B = [20 + 1, 2 - 15, -3 - 8]

A x B = [21, -13, -11]

So, the cross product of vector A and vector B is [21, -13, -11].
